title: Posting modified information in 'Investment section' will cause unintended information change in verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi

profile.name: LocalTapiola
profile.about: LocalTapiolaâ€™s products and services cover non-life, life and pension insurance, as well as investment and saving services.

vulnerability_information:
Hello,

Some strange account information modification is ongoing when intercepting and making small modifications to requests in 'investment section'.

Login to portal and go to buy shares

https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/jb2/ltvr/purchases or similar 

and pic 2025 A shares, intercept requests and edit response from
https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/jb2/ltvr/rest/fund?fundRef=-1&fundKey=&accountKey=&accountRef=&opener=

find and edit params
***"firstName":"dipadu","lastName":"something"***

forward request. Purchase shares but do not buy / use banks payment. 

go to normal localtapiola customer portal (name is still normal?). 

(does not require this but confirms that you do have managed to purchase shares
Goto
https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/jb2/ltvr/custodialaccounts
and purchase should be visible...)

Goto https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/a2/AskoWeb/ProfileServlet?resource=asko_frontpage and your name involved to ANY previously named contacts is changed to "dipadu something". Also your username /name. ("PIC ATTACHED")

First, i do not know if you are supposed to buy shares with imagination name (i used Topi Sorsakoski with fake social security number)? It is also possible to fake social security number here.

Second, this one "buy" procedure make changes to customer portal names (in this case Topi Sorsakoski). What the ****? :) When portal user data is modified thru this request, i could test to change somebody elses account information. These forms (when buying shares) asks address and other thing which is then moved / will replace REAL account fields? By changing account ID (maybe social security number?) could damage be done to other account holders? Did not tested this one but should be taken in to account when tested in-house.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello,

Some strange account information modification is ongoing when intercepting and making small modifications to requests in 'investment section'.

Login to portal and go to buy shares

https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/jb2/ltvr/purchases or similar

and pic 2025 A shares, intercept requests and edit response from
https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/jb2/ltvr/rest/fund?fundRef=-1&fundKey=&accountKey=&accountRef=&opener=

find and edit params
"firstName":"dipadu","lastName":"something"

forward request. Purchase shares but do not buy / use banks payment.

go to normal localtapiola customer portal (name is still normal?).

(does not require this but confirms that you do have managed to purchase shares
Goto
https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/jb2/ltvr/custodialaccounts
and purchase should be visible...)

Goto https://verkkopalvelu.tapiola.fi/a2/AskoWeb/ProfileServlet?resource=asko_frontpage and your name involved to ANY previously named contacts is changed to "dipadu something". Also your username /name. ("PIC ATTACHED")

First, i do not know if you are supposed to buy shares with imagination name (i used Topi Sorsakoski with fake social security number)? It is also possible to fake social security number here.

Second, this one "buy" procedure make changes to customer portal names (in this case Topi Sorsakoski). What the ****? :) When portal user data is modified thru this request, i could test to change somebody elses account information. These forms (when buying shares) asks address and other thing which is then moved / will replace REAL account fields? By changing account ID (maybe social security number?) could damage be done to other account holders? Did not tested this one but should be taken in to account when tested in-house.

activities.message: Hello @billy_blaze. We are looking into this report and its potential business impacts.
activities.markdown_message: Hello @billy_blaze. We are looking into this report and its potential business impacts.

activities.message: @billy_blaze would you have the opportunity to retest this issue? There has been a (partial) fix which should at least remediate the "what the ****" -part of your report. Nevertheless, before marking this as fixed and moving on, I would like to have your feedback.

activities.message:
Hi,

Will do so. Hopefully my account does not suffer much (in overall) about my testings and everything is in place as it should be.

Thanks for smiles. Will get back after ice hockey game.

activities.message:
Exact replay will produce some broken layout . Pic attached. Fix working, replay will not change the name and other info anymore and quite quickly forces you to log out.  Perhaps related to the error generated.

I had the same "error" while testing other stuff day or two  ago. 

.
activities.markdown_message:
Exact replay will produce some broken layout . Pic attached. Fix working, replay will not change the name and other info anymore and quite quickly forces you to log out. Perhaps related to the error generated.

I had the same "error" while testing other stuff day or two ago.

.

activities.message: Thank you for checking and verifying this, we will process this further during next week and I will keep you posted on what we decide.

activities.message: Hi, we would like to do a public disclosure on this - is this OK with you?
activities.markdown_message: Hi, we would like to do a public disclosure on this - is this OK with you?

activities.message: Public disclosure OK. Thanks again for the bounty!
activities.markdown_message: Public disclosure OK. Thanks again for the bounty!

summaries.content:
##Issue

The reporter found that it was possible to manipulate and fake personal information while purchasing shares. Additionally, it was suspected that by manipulating ones own personal information, the situation could lead to manipulation of other peoples accounts and impersonating a third party while purchasing shares. 

##Fix

The issue was investigated and the potential risk was found to be real. While investigating this, there was no actual proof found that impersonating would have resulted in damage to other customers. The fix was rolled out and the reporter subsequently verified that the fix was "good enough". 

##Reasoning

LocalTapiola has processes, both automatic as well as manual, in the backend which aim to ensure that potential issues like this - even if realized - do not cause damage to customers, customer accounts nor customer information. Although there was no proof that any real damage could have been done, this was nevertheless a potential issue that required immediate action. LocalTapiola based the bounty decision on the potential business impact.
summaries.content_html:
Issue

The reporter found that it was possible to manipulate and fake personal information while purchasing shares. Additionally, it was suspected that by manipulating ones own personal information, the situation could lead to manipulation of other peoples accounts and impersonating a third party while purchasing shares.

Fix

The issue was investigated and the potential risk was found to be real. While investigating this, there was no actual proof found that impersonating would have resulted in damage to other customers. The fix was rolled out and the reporter subsequently verified that the fix was "good enough".

Reasoning

LocalTapiola has processes, both automatic as well as manual, in the backend which aim to ensure that potential issues like this - even if realized - do not cause damage to customers, customer accounts nor customer information. Although there was no proof that any real damage could have been done, this was nevertheless a potential issue that required immediate action. LocalTapiola based the bounty decision on the potential business impact.
